name: Partner Portal: Having Issues Logging in?
title: Partner Portal: Having Issues Logging in?
body:
If you're experiencing difficulties with logging in to your KnowBe4 Partner Portal account, here are some quick tips to resolve these issues:

  • Ensure you have received your Partner Portal login credentials. If you're already a KnowBe4 partner but don't have login credentials yet, visit our Partner Portal | Login Request page to request your credentials.
  • Ensure you're entering your username correctly in the Partner Portal login window. It should be your business email plus .kb4.
  • If the above two points don't resolve your issue, you can reset your password.

If you have forgotten your Partner Portal password, follow the steps below to reset your password:

  1. Navigate to the KnowBe4 Partner Portal | Forgot Password? page.
  2. Enter your username, which is your business email, followed by .kb4.
  3. Click Reset Password.
  4. You'll receive an email that will allow you to set a new password. Click the link in the email.
    Note:If you have not received the email, follow the instructions in our Partner Portal: How to Troubleshoot Whitelisting Issues article. You can also check your spam folder and filters for the reset link. The email will come from kb4partners "at" knowbe4.com.
  5. Create a new password using the requirements listed on the page. Then, click Change Password.

If you're still unable to log in to your Partner Portal, you can submit a ticket on our KnowBe4 Partner Portal | Support page for assistance.

images.alt:
The image displays a **PASSWORD RESET** interface screen characterized by an orange and peach-toned background with faint abstract geometric shapes.

**Key UI Elements and Text:**

1.  **Title:** The screen header is prominently displayed in uppercase as **PASSWORD RESET**.
2.  **Instructional Text:** Guidance text below the title provides specific username requirements and process description: "Your username is your business email + .kb4. Enter it below, and we'll send you an email with a link to reset your password."
3.  **Input Field:** A single white text input field is present.
    *   **Placeholder/Label:** "Username" is displayed, preceded by a user silhouette icon.
    *   **Iconography:** A small, stylized padlock icon is centered within the right side of the input field.
4.  **Primary Call to Action (CTA):** A prominent orange button labeled **Reset Password**.
5.  **Secondary Action:** A text link located beneath the primary button labeled **Cancel**.
images.context:
is your business email, followed by .kb4.
Click Reset Password.

images.alt:
This image displays a password change interface, branded with the **KnowBe4** logo and the tagline, "Human error. Conquered." The background is orange with abstract pattern overlays.

**Title and Context:**
The primary function is indicated by the title, "Change Your Password."

**Password Requirements and Constraints:**
The UI specifies requirements for the new password, presented as a checklist (unselected radio buttons):
*   16 characters
*   1 letter
*   1 number

**Input Fields:**
The form contains two required, empty input fields:
1.  **\* New Password:** Input box includes a small icon (likely for showing/hiding the password or generating a strong password).
2.  **\* Confirm New Password:** Input box includes an identical icon.

**Action Button and State:**
A primary action button, labeled "**Change Password**," is present but currently disabled (greyed out), indicating that the form inputs must be valid before submission is possible.

**Metadata:**
A footer note provides historical context: "Password was last changed on 11/1/2019 4:56 PM."
